title: LIVE: Nigeria confirms US strikes on ISIL targets in its northwest
summary: Nigeria says US claims that Christians face persecution ‌do not represent a complex security situation.

summary: Malaysian high court finds former PM Najib guilty in trial related to the 1MDB sovereign wealth fund scandal.

title: Israeli settler runs over Palestinian man praying near Ramallah
summary: An Israeli settler ran over a Palestinian man while he was praying by the roadside near Ramallah.

title: Japan gov’t greenlights record $58bn defence budget amid regional tension
summary: Japan’s cabinet has backed a record defence spending plan amid mounting tensions with China.

title: Palestinian economy faces critical downturn amid escalating fiscal crisis
summary: Public debt reaches $14.6bn, exceeding GDP, while unemployment in Gaza hits a staggering 77 percent by late 2025.

title: Cambodia blames Thailand for ‘ruthless’ bombardment amid border talks
summary: US offers to mediate more talks to end the latest flare-up of violence, which has upended an October peace accord.

title: North Korea’s Kim Jong Un pushes more missile production as ‘war deterrent’
summary: North Korean leader calls for increased production of missiles, shells and more factories to produce them.

title: US releases missile launch video after northwest Nigeria strike
summary: The US Department of War published footage of a missile being fired on Nigeria.

title: Polish jets intercept Russian reconnaissance plane spotted near airspace
summary: Poland's defence minister said Russian aircraft was 'escorted' from area and did not pose immediate security threat.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,401
summary: These are the key developments from day 1,401 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: ‘A comedy show’: Myanmar youth in exile slam military-run ‘sham’ election
summary: Myanmar tattooist Ng La cares little for the national election organised by his country's despised military leaders.

title: Trump says US launched strike against ISIL in northwest Nigeria
summary: US president says 'deadly strike' in Nigeria targeted ISIL fighters who killed 'primarily, innocent Christians'.

title: Pour les chrétiens de Syrie, un Noël malgré les blessures, le deuil et l'inquiétude
summary: Un an après la chute du régime de Bachar al-Assad, les festivités de Noël se déroulent cette année sous le signe du deuil et de l’inquiétude pour les chrétiens de Syrie. À Damas et dans le village de Maaloula, la communauté chrétienne tente de célébrer, malgré les cicatrices laissées par les violences et un climat d’insécurité persistant.

title: Israël dit avoir tué un combattant de la force iranienne Al-Qods dans une frappe au Liban
summary: L'armée israélienne a annoncé avoir tué jeudi au Liban un "terroriste" de la force Al-Qods, branche des opérations extérieures des Gardiens de la révolution iraniens. Israël l'accusait de planifier des attaques "depuis la Syrie et le Liban".

title: Reconnaissance de la Palestine en 2025 : une victoire diplomatique, et après ?
summary: La reconnaissance de l’État de Palestine par plusieurs pays occidentaux en septembre, à l’initiative de la France, s'impose comme l'un des événements diplomatiques de l'année 2025. Ce tournant essentiellement symbolique pour les Palestiniens peut-il marquer la fin d’une impasse géopolitique vieille de plusieurs décennies ?

title: Noël à Gaza : une seule église reste debout dans l'enclave
summary: A Gaza, les fidèles se réunissent dans la seule église encore debout dans l'enclave devastée par la guerre.

title: Fêtes de Noël à Taybeh, seul village entièrement chrétien de Cisjordanie
summary: Père Bashar Fawadleh, Curé de l'Eglise latine de Taybeh, est notre invité.

title: Bethléem fête son premier Noël depuis le début de la guerre à Gaza
summary: Bethléem, ville de Cisjordanie occupée et berceau du christianisme, a célébré mercredi son premier Noël festif depuis le début de la guerre à Gaza, alors qu'à des milliers de kilomètres de là, le pape Léon XIV célébrait au Vatican la première messe de Noël de son pontificat.

title: Syrie : un haut responsable de l'EI arrêté près de Damas avec l’appui de la coalition
summary: Les forces de sécurité syriennes ont annoncé l’arrestation, mercredi soir près de Damas, d’un haut responsable du groupe État islamique, lors d’une opération menée avec la coalition internationale dirigée par les États-Unis. Cette annonce intervient plus de 10 jours après une attaque meurtrière attribuée à l’EI contre des soldats américains dans le centre du pays.

title: La France et treize autres pays appellent Israël à cesser l'expansion des colonies en Cisjordanie
summary: Quatorze pays, dont la France, ont condamné mercredi l'approbation récente par le gouvernement israélien de la création de 19 nouvelles colonies en Cisjordanie occupée. Parmi les pays a avoir diffusé le communiqué commun figurent l'Allemagne, le Japon ou encore le Royaume-Uni.

title: Cisjordanie : l'esprit de Noël de retour à Bethléem après deux ans de guerre
summary: Les scouts palestiniens ont paradé mercredi à Bethléem, marquant le début des festivités de Noël dans la ville de Cisjordanie considérée comme le berceau du christianisme par la tradition chrétienne. La trêve entrée en vigueur en octobre rend possible le premier Noël festif depuis le début de la guerre à Gaza il y a plus de deux ans.

title: Syrie : à Raqqa, la multiplication des tunnels fait craindre un nouveau conflit
summary: Alors que l’accord signé le 10 mars 2025 entre les Forces démocratiques syriennes (FDS) et le gouvernement syrien arrive à son terme, des travaux de creusement de tunnels se multiplient dans les quartiers résidentiels de Raqqa, dans le nord-est de la Syrie. Des habitants de la ville font part de leur inquiétude d’une militarisation souterraine de la ville.

title: Cisjordanie : les fermiers palestiniens face aux assauts des colons
summary: En Cisjordanie, les villages palestiniens subissent des attaques répétées menées par des colons israéliens. D’après l’ONU, ces derniers ont commis près de 260 agressions contre des habitations, commerces et fermes palestiniens rien qu'en octobre 2025. Les fermes, notamment les oliveraies, constituent des cibles privilégiées pour les colons.

title: Mort du chef d'état-major libyen dans un crash en Turquie
summary: Le chef d'état-major libyen est mort dans un accident d'avion en Turquie. L'appareil s'est écrasé dans la soirée avec huit personnes à bord. Peu avant, il avait signalé un dysfonctionnement électrique. Le contact avait été perdu moins de 40 minutes après le décollage. L'épave a été retrouvée. Qui était ce général ? En quoi cet accident risque-t-il de bouleverser la situation en Libye ? Et qui pour remplacer cet homme clé du GNU ? La réponse avec William Lawrence, spécialiste de la région.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : Volodymyr Zelensky annonce qu’il va rencontrer Donald Trump « dans un proche avenir »
summary: Alors que les pourparlers avec les Etats-Unis se poursuivent, une nouvelle proposition de plan de paix a été mise en ligne mardi par le président ukrainien. La Russie n’a pas encore réagi. « Beaucoup de choses pourraient se décider avant la nouvelle année », annonce toutefois Volodymyr Zelensky sur Telegram, sans plus de précisions.

title: Marioupol, en Ukraine, la ville vitrine de la « Nouvelle Russie »
summary: Depuis 2015, le photographe Gabriele Micalizzi arpente le Donbass du côté russe de la ligne de front, une zone où les conditions d’accès édictées par Moscou sont très strictes pour les journalistes. En novembre, il a obtenu l’autorisation de pénétrer dans l’oblast de Donetsk, en Ukraine occupée, et s’est rendu à Marioupol, ville détruite par les Russes en 2022, avant d’être colonisée et reconstruite en un temps record.

title: En Israël, les survivants du festival Tribe of Nova seuls face à leur traumatisme
summary: En grande détresse plus de deux ans après le 7-Octobre, les 3 750 rescapés du massacre perpétré par le Hamas se sentent abandonnés par les pouvoirs publics.

title: Kim Jong-un ordonne une hausse de la production de missiles et la construction de nouvelles usines de munitions
summary: La Corée du Nord a considérablement intensifié ses lancements de missiles ces dernières années.

title: « The Barents Observer », refuge de journalistes russes en exil
summary: Fondé en 2002 à Kirkenes, à l’extrême nord de la Norvège, tout près de la frontière avec la Russie, le média en ligne, qui diffuse des articles et des podcasts en russe et en anglais, est la cible d’intimidations de la part du Kremlin.

title: Donald Trump annonce de « nombreuses » frappes meurtrières contre l’organisation Etat islamique au Nigeria
summary: Pour la première fois sous la présidence du républicain, Washington intervient militairement, « à la demande des autorités nigérianes », dans ce pays d’Afrique de l’Ouest, accusé par la Maison Blanche de tolérer les massacres de chrétiens.

title: Au Venezuela, au moins 99 personnes emprisonnées après la présidentielle contestée de 2024 ont été libérées
summary: Parmi les personnes relâchées jeudi figurent des opposants emblématiques, mais la plupart placées restent sous contrôle judiciaire strict, illustrant la persistance des tensions politiques au Venezuela.

title: En Turquie, 137 membres présumés de l’EI ont été arrêtés avant Noël et le Nouvel An
summary: Ankara multiplie les opérations visant à contrer les réseaux djihadistes à l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année.

title: Jimmy Kimmel dénonce « une très bonne année » pour le fascisme aux Etats-Unis, à la télévision britannique
summary: L’humoriste, dont l’émission avait été suspendue aux Etats-Unis en septembre, a été choisi par la Channel 4 pour adresser le traditionnel message de Noël alternatif à celui du monarque britannique.

title: En Californie, les autorités alertent la population sur le risque d’inondations après les fortes pluies qui se sont abattues le jour de Noël
summary: Une « rivière atmosphérique », un phénomène météo qui emporte de la vapeur d’eau des tropiques jusqu’aux côtes et provoque des précipitations massives, frappe la Californie depuis deux jours. Mercredi, l’état d’urgence a été décrété pour Los Angeles et sa région par le gouverneur.

title: Au Honduras, Nasry Asfura remporte l’élection présidentielle grâce au soutien de Donald Trump
summary: Après vingt-cinq jours d’un décompte chaotique des suffrages, le candidat du Parti national a été déclaré vainqueur face à son adversaire du Parti libéral. Il l’emporte à l’issue d’une campagne marquée par la grâce accordée par le président américain à l’ancien président Juan Orlando Hernandez, condamné pour trafic de drogue.

title: Le Britannique Imran Ahmed, interdit de séjour aux Etats-Unis pour son rôle dans la régulation de la tech, contre-attaque en justice
summary: Le département d’Etat américain qualifie de « censure » les mesures européennes de contrôle des contenus en ligne et a sanctionné mardi cinq personnes, dont le Français Thierry Breton.

title: Israeli warplanes carry out intense strikes in Khan Younis, continue shelling Gaza
summary:
Israeli warplanes carry out intense strikes in Khan Younis, continue shelling Gaza

Israeli warplanes on Friday carried out intense air strikes east of the city of Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip, Palestinian media reported. 

Wafa news agency said that artillery shelling and demolitions continued across the eastern areas of Gaza. 

At least four airstrikes targeted areas across Khan Younis, along with heavy gunfire from helicopters and Israeli military vehicles positioned around the city.

The report said that Israeli forces also carried out large-scale demolition operations, destroying homes as warplanes launched an air strike in the area. 

In Rafah, Israeli helicopters fired on residential neighbourhoods, as Israeli naval ships continuously targeted the coast of Khan Younis.

title: Israeli forces raid farm near Ramallah, assault workers and steal 150 sheep
summary:
Israeli forces raid farm near Ramallah, assault workers and steal 150 sheep

Israeli military on Friday assaulted two Palestinians and stole around 150 sheep during an attack on a farm in the town of Deir Dibwan, east of Ramallah, local media reported. 

The report by Wafa news said that the forces raided a farm owned by Hassan Mohammad Ghannam in the Khallet al-Louz area east of the town, brutally assaulting two workers before stealing 150 sheep and fleeing the scene.

title: Israeli forces shut Atara checkpoint, disrupt movement north of Ramallah
summary:
Israeli forces shut Atara checkpoint, disrupt movement north of Ramallah

Israeli forces on Friday closed the Atara military checkpoint north of Ramallah disrupted the movement of Palestinians, Palestinian media reported. 

Wafa news said the closure had been in place since the early hours on Friday and disrupted the movement of Palestinians travelling to villages west of Ramallah, as well as those coming from the northern West Bank districts.

title: Channel 12: US frustrated with Israel, may announce Gaza peace council next month
summary:
Channel 12: US frustrated with Israel, may announce Gaza peace council next month

The US may announce a peace council, a technocratic government, and a stabilisation force in Gaza next month, Israel's Channel 12 quoted White House officials as saying. 

The officials said that US President Donald Trump wants to see the announcement of a peace council and that Trump's team is "increasingly frustrated with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's steps that undermine the agreement."

The officials accused Israel of stalling on implementing the ceasefire agreement and violating it, according to Israel's Channel 12.

"It seems that the Israelis have been regretting the Gaza agreement for some time," the official said.

title: Israeli soldier runs over Palestinian man during prayer in West Bank village
summary:
Israeli soldier runs over Palestinian man during prayer in West Bank village

An armed Israeli soldier ran over a Palestinian Muslim man with his four-wheel drive vehicle while he was praying in Deir Jarir, east of Ramallah.

Israeli media said that the perpetrator was a reservist soldier who had earlier fired a gun inside the village where five Israelis were arrested for throwing stones at a Palestinian house, wounding an eight-month-old baby.

title: Israeli settlers expand outpost near Nablus, rights group says
summary:
Israeli settlers expand outpost near Nablus, rights group says

Israeli settlers on Friday expanded an illegal settlement outpost on Palestinian land in the city of Nablus in the northern part of the occupied West Bank, Anadolu news agency reported. 

Settler groups added prefabricated houses to an illegal settlement outpost established on Mount Qarqafa, southeast of Nablus, human rights group Al-Baidar said in statement. 

The report said that nearly 451,000 Israelis in the occupied West Bank and around 230,000 in East Jerusalem are living on seized Palestinian land.

title: Israeli warships, artillery target Gaza City and Khan Younis
summary:
Israeli warships, artillery target Gaza City and Khan Younis

Israeli forces on Friday opened fire towards the eastern areas of Khan Younis city in the southern Gaza Strip, Palestinian media reported. 

Gaza-based journalists reported that Israeli warships fired heavily off the coast of Khan Younis and also opened fire towards the city. 

Reports said that the Israeli army continued to demolish homes in the Tuffah neighbourhood of Gaza City, as Israeli artillery shelling targeted eastern areas of the city.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the latest updates from Israel's war on Palestinians in Gaza and the West Bank:

  • Israel targeted eastern Gaza and Khan Younis with back-to-back air strikes, while the Israeli army continued to demolish homes in the Tuffah neighbourhood of Gaza City. 

  • Journalists based in Gaza reported that Israeli warships were firing heavily off the coast of Khan Younis and also opened fire towards the eastern areas of the city. 

  • Israeli settler groups expanded an illegal settlement outpost in the city of Nablus in the northern part of the occupied West Bank and added prefabricated houses to the outpost on Mount Qarqafa. 

  • An Israeli soldier ran over a Palestinian Muslim with his four-wheel drive vehicle while he was praying in Deir Jarir, east of Ramallah. The video was shared with shock on social media platforms within a few hours.

  • The Israeli army said it intercepted two drones that infiltrated from the direction of the border with Egypt.

title: Five Israeli settlers arrested after they injure an eight-month-old in attack on Palestinian town
summary:
Five Israeli settlers arrested after they injure an eight-month-old in attack on Palestinian town

Five Israeli settlers are said to have been arrested on Thursday after they attacked a Palestinian home and injured an eight-month-old girl in the occupied West Bank.

A group of armed settlers attacked homes and property in the town of Sair, north of Hebron.

An eight-month-old infant suffered "injuries to the face and head" in the attacks on Wednesdy, according to Wafa news agency.

The attacks have been called "serious, violent incidents" by the Israeli police, who rarely condemn instances of sttler brutality, wbich have sharply incresed since Israel's war on Gaza that started in 2023.

More than half a million Israelis live in settlements in the occupied West Bank, which are illegal under international law.

The West Bank is home to around three million Palestinians and has been occupied since 1967.

title: Israelis kill two additional Palestinians crossing the 'Yellow Line' on Christmas Day
summary:
Israelis kill two additional Palestinians crossing the 'Yellow Line' on Christmas Day

Israeli soldiers killed two more Palestinians who crossed the 'Yellow Line' on Thursday (Christmas day).

Soldiers had also killed a Palestinian earlier in the day who had tried to cross the 'Yellow Line'. 

Personal information about the victims have not yet been released. 

The Israeli military have taken over more than 50 per cent of the Gaza Strip, demarcated by the 'Yellow Line',  which remains largely unmarked on the ground.

Israeli soldiers have been killing people who are crossing the 'Yellow Line' on a daily basis and have consistently released statements that accuse the victims of being "terrorists," including two young cbildren. 

Evidence of any of the Palestinians killed being terrorists has yet to be released.

title: Israeli military court gives attorney general's office three days to respond to request to drop Sde Teimen indictment
summary:
Israeli military court gives attorney general's office three days to respond to request to drop Sde Teimen indictment

The president of an Israeli military court today ordered the attorney general's office to respond within three days to a request to drop an indictment against five reserve soldiers accused of brutally abusing a Palestinian detainee in Sde Teiman detention center in 2024.

The footage, which was broadcast last August, shows Israeli soldiers at the Sde Teiman military base in southern Israel pulling a detainee aside, surrounding him with riot shields to block visibility while he was beaten and stabbed in the rectum with a sharp object.

The detainee was treated for severe injuries.

The five reserve soldiers were charged with aggravated abuse and causing serious bodily harm to the detainee, but denied the charges.

Military Advocate General of the Israeli military Maj Gen Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi took responsibility for the leak and resigned at the end of October following outrage in Israel over the leak. 

 Her successor, Itay Offir, former legal adviser to the Defense Ministry, took office at the end of November.

The soldiers' lawyers filed a request to dismiss the indictment in November.

title: Israeli soldiers kill a Palestinian who crossed the 'Yellow Line in Gaza
summary:
Israeli soldiers kill a Palestinian who crossed the 'Yellow Line in Gaza

Israeli soldiers killed a Palestinian who crossed the 'Yellow Line', according to a statement the Israeli military made on Thursday, Haaretz reported. 

The Israeli military have taken over 50 per cent of the Gaza Strip, demarcated by the 'Yellow Line',  which remains largely unmarked on the ground. Israeli soldiers have been killing people who are crossing the 'Yellow Line'.

title: Gharibabadi: Enemy’s strikes on civilians during war proved nuclear issue was just an excuse
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Deputy Foreign Minister for Legal and International Affairs Kazem Gharibabadi has emphasized that the enemy’s attacks that struck civilians and residential areas during the illegal and unprovoked Israeli-American war on the Islamic Republic in June, demonstrated that the nuclear issue was merely a pretext for targeting the country.

title: Araghchi: Iran’s enemies trying to make up for military losses with economic warfare
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has stressed that Iran’s enemies have shifted their pressure tactics towards economic warfare after failing to achieve their objectives through military means, targeting the livelihoods of ordinary Iranians.

summary: Tehran, IRNA – Masoud Pezeshkian has met the family of Razmik Khachatorian, a Christian martyr of Iran, to pay tribute to his memory.

title: Araghchi: Foreign Ministry supports export of technological products
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi has stressed that the diplomatic service is committed to international marketing and supporting the export of Iranian technological products, especially in the field of renewable energy.

summary: Tehran, IRNA – The prime minister of Armenia has announced his country’s willingness to sign a strategic partnership agreement with Iran, emphasizing the strong relations between the two neighboring nations.

summary: The celebration of the birth of Jesus Christ was held on late December 24, 2025, at the Saint Gregory the Illuminator Church and the Saint Joseph Assyrian Catholic Church.

title: Foreign Ministry spokesman extends congratulations on birth anniversary of Jesus Christ
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Esmaeil Baqaei, spokesman for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, has issued a congratulatory message on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Jesus Christ (PBUH).

title: Foreign Ministry’s first mission is to work for lifting sanctions: Araghchi
summary: Isfahan, IRNA – Minister of Foreign Affairs Abbas Araghchi says his ministry currently has two important missions, the first and most significant of which is the effort to lift sanctions.

summary: Tehran, IRNA – President Masoud Pezeshkian has sent a message to Pope Leo XIV, leader of the Catholic Church, extending his best wishes on the birth anniversary of Jesus Christ and the arrival of the New Year.

title: West seeks to halt Iran’s scientific progress: Nuclear chief
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran’s nuclear chief says the West’s core dispute with the Islamic Republic is not nuclear weapons but the country’s scientific and technological advancement.

title: Leader: Ayatollah Milani truly revived Mashhad seminary
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei has described the late Grand Ayatollah Seyyed Mohammad Hadi Milani as a truly multifaceted figure in spiritual, moral, scholarly, and socio-political terms, stressing that he “really was the reviver of the Mashhad seminary.”

summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 26 (MNA) – Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has extended his congratulations to Christians in Iran and around the world on the occasion of the birth of Jesus Christ.

summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 26 (MNA) – Explosions were heard in Yemen’s eastern Hadramout province following a reported Saudi airstrike, according to regional media.

summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 26 (MNA) – The monumental "Yalda Storyology Collection" archives over 8,000 Iranian folktales, safeguarding the oral traditions of the ancient winter solstice celebration for future generations in a definitive 16-volume set.

summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 26 (MNA) – Ukrainian leader Vladimir Zelensky would overwhelmingly lose in a run-off presidential election to his former top commander, Valery Zaluzhny, according to a Socis poll published on Wednesday.

title: Ayt. Milani's letter to Imam Khomeini historical document
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 25 (MNA) – Ayatollah Milani’s letter in support of Imam Khomeini (ra) after the Imam’s exile to Turkey is a historical document, according to the Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei on Thursday.

summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 25 (MNA) – Gaza officials have warned of an impending humanitarian and medical catastrophe in the territory as the Israeli occupying regime is using medince as a weapon of war.

title: North Korea unveils first nuclear submarine
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 25 (MNA) – North Korea released photographs Thursday showing what appears to be a largely completed nuclear-powered submarine hull, as leader Kim Jong-un blasted South Korea's push to acquire similar technology.

title: یک طلا و یک برنز سهم آذربایجان شرقی از مسابقات کشتی قهرمانی کشور
summary: تبریز- میزبانی آذربایجان شرقی از مسابقات کشتی آزاد قهرمانی کشور یک طلا و یک برنز به همراه داشت.

title: زمان ثبت نام داوطلبین عضویت در هیئت ممیزه پیام نور اعلام شد
summary: معاون آموزشی و تحصیلات تکمیلی دانشگاه پیام نور از آغاز فرآیند ثبت‌نام داوطلبان عضویت در انتخابات هیئت ممیزه دانشگاه خبر داد.

title: ماجرای قطعی گاز در خوابگاه دانش آموزی عشایری شیراز چه بود؟
summary: شیراز-قطعی چندساعته گاز در یک خوابگاه شبانه‌روزی متعلق به مدرسه عشایری حواشی را ایجاد کرد که روابط عمومی شرکت گاز استان فارس این قطعی را ناشی‌از ناایمن بودن وسایل گرمایشی این مکان عنوان کرد.

title: حمله توپخانه رژیم صهیونیستی به جنوب سوریه
summary: منابع سوری از تحرکات جدید رژیم صهیونیستی در قنیطره در جنوب سوریه خبر دادند.

title: رویداد «ایده‌های برتر شیمی و سلامت در کرمانشاه» برگزار میشود
summary: کرمانشاه - معاون تحقیقات و فناوری دانشگاه علوم پزشکی کرمانشاه از برگزاری رویداد «ایده‌های برتر شیمی و سلامت» با هدف حمایت از ایده‌های نوآورانه در هفته آینده خبر داد.

title: آزمون تخصصی اخذ پروانه کارگزاران گمرکی سال ۱۴۰۴ در کرمانشاه برگزار شد
summary: کرمانشاه - ناظر گمرکات استان کرمانشاه گفت: آزمون اخذ پروانه کارگزاران گمرکی صبح روز جمعه ۵ دی‌ماه با حضور ۵۰۰ داوطلب و به میزبانی استان کرمانشاه همزمان با چند استان دیگر کشور برگزار شد.
